page.title: 06Agriculture Part 2
page.content: {Church Farm}consists of 367 acres of p asture land.The bulk of the acreage is close to the farm.However,following th e modern trend a number of fields are several miles away.It is a good exampl e of a well run modern farm.The centra l feature is the {computer controlled {milking parlour}which was installed in 1983 at a cost of Â£50,000.The pedigree herd of Friesian cows is housed during winter in an{open plan shippon.}In add ition there are several buildings for housing young stock.Other buildings in clude 3 hay barns,some buildings for s toring farm vehicles and machinery.The re are 3 large{silage pits}and an unde rground {slurry pit.}Slurry is a perpe tual problem.For example,the trout fis hery on the farm was ruined by slurry pollution.Such pollution is a problem for the fisheries on all the local flashes.
